title: Citi Earns Perfect Score on LGBT Workplace Equality Scorecard
summary: New York - For the 13th consecutive year, Citi received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2017 Corporate Equality Index (CEI). The national survey benchmarks corporate policies and practices for LGBT workplace equality.
tag-1: Citi Earns Perfect Score on LGBT Workplace Equality Scorecard
tag-3: New York – For the 13th consecutive year, Citi received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2017 Corporate Equality Index (CEI). The national survey benchmarks corporate policies and practices for LGBT workplace equality.
tag-4: "We are proud to be included once again on the CEI alongside other companies working to promote and maintain workplace equality. With a diverse and inclusive workforce that encourages a range of perspectives and experiences, we are able to generate new ideas and solutions that ultimately lead to better outcomes for our clients and partners," said Terry Hogan, Global Head of Diversity and Director, Talent Management.
tag-5: The 2017 CEI evaluates LGBT-related policies and practices including non-discrimination workplace protections, domestic partner benefits, transgender-inclusive health care benefits, competency programs, and public engagement with the LGBT community. Citi satisfied all of the CEI's criteria results with a 100 percent ranking and the designation as a Best Place to Work for LGBT Equality.
tag-6: For more information on the 2017 Corporate Equality Index, or to download a free copy of the report, visit www.hrc.org/cei.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
